name: Watercolor Fundamentals and Intro to Color Theory
description:
An inspiring 2 day workshop filled with painting demonstrations, fundamental watercolor and color theory exercises, individual painting instruction and critiques. This workshop focuses
on the fundamentals of watercolor and color theory and how to use it to create dynamic
paintings. 

Whether you are new to watercolor or have been painting with
mixed results, this class is for you!  Learn the fundamentals  ~
washes, transitions, isolating whites, wet into wet, glazing and more. I will
share with you my techniques for clean and luminous watercolors.

Also, learn how to use hue, value and intensity to bring mood and impact to your paintings.

When ~ Saturday & Sunday, January 25th & 26th - 10am to 4pm

Where ~ Placerville

Cost ~ $120
Materials list and directions to studio provided upon registration.

name: Painting Shiny Objects in Hawaii
description:
I will share with you my techniques for creating shiny objects, such as glass and silver. Participants will learn how to use glazing and values to create an illusion of shiny objects!

* All skill levels with some watercolor experience are welcome! 

* Lots of demonstrations and plenty of individual attention.

* Work from your own photo or one provided. (will be different from image shown)

Materials list and tips on choosing a good reference photo will be provided upon registration.

When: February 8th & 9th (Sat/Sun) 10am to 4pm

Cost: $200

Material list will be provided upon registration.

Drinks will be provided, please bring food to share for casual potluck lunches.

When: February 7th, 8th and 9th (Fri/Sat/Sun) 10am to 4pm 

Where: Kohala Intergenerational Center at Kamehameha Park in Kapa'au, on the northern tip of the Big Island.

name: Painting a Toucan in Hawaii Workshop
description:
This is a great class for beginners with some experience to advanced watercolorists. 
You will learn wet into wet techniques, how to keep your colors clean, bright and more!

When: February 7th (Fri) 10am to 4pm
Where: Kohala Intergenerational Center at Kamehameha Park in Kapa'au,
on the northern tip of the Big Island.

(email Tracy @ thebubble94@yahoo.com for materials list)

Cost: $100

name: All 3 Days ~ Toucan and Shiny Objects in Hawaii
description:
Day 1 ~ Toucan

This is a great class for beginners with some experience to advanced
 watercolorists. 
You will learn wet into wet techniques, how to keep your colors clean, bright and more!


Day 2&3 ~ Shiny Objects

Tracy will share her techniques for creating the illusion of glass and silver objects in watercolor using luminous glazes and dramatic values! 
Work from your own photo or one provided.

Lots of demonstrations and plenty of individual attention.
  
Work from your own photo or one provided. 

Materials list and tips on choosing a good reference photo will be provided upon registration.

When: February 7th, 8th & 9th   (Sat/Sun) 10am to 4pm

Cost: $250

Where: Kohala Intergenerational Center at Kamehameha Park in Kapa'au, 
on the northern tip of the Big Island.



Materials list and tips on choosing a good reference phot0 for portraits will be provided upon registration.

Drinks will be provided, please bring food to share for casual potluck lunches.
